medium: Colored lacquer, wood and metal, polished goldstone
title: Inro_ (tiered case) with carved decor; Kagamibuta-style netsuke with lion dog
description: Inro, medicine or perfume container in five sections with head slide and square wooden netsuke with round metal disk, design in relief.  Box of incised lacquer of cinnabar lac covered with dark brown, scroll design.  Inside nashi-ji finish, gold foil scattered on reddish brown bed.  Probably 19th century, although the style started under Chien Lung (1736-1795).
